business.headline: Russian oil taps turned off. What it means for Indian refinersIndia's cheap Russian oil phase is fading as sanctions tighten. Refiners are shifting to costlier US and Middle Eastern grades, raising import costs and likely putting eventual pressure on fuel prices.

Sensex, Nifty fall despite US Fed rate cut; all eyes on Trump-Xi meetingThe S&P BSE Sensex declined 251.52 points to 84,745.61 at 9:23 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 81.55 points to 25,972.35. Broader market indices also edged lower in early trade, tracking a mix of caution and profit booking.

This Sebi proposal may benefit your mutual fund investmentIn its consultation paper released on Tuesday, Sebi said the goal is to ensure that investors benefit more directly from the growing size of India's mutual fund industry. Sebi has invited public comments on the proposal until November 17.

Gold, silver rate today: Has US Fed rate cut impacted precious metal prices?Spot gold was up 0.4% at $3,942.97 per ounce. However, US gold futures for December delivery slipped 1.1% to $3,955 per ounce, indicating some profit booking after the recent gains.

US Fed rate cut by 25 bps: How will it impact Sensex, Nifty today?According to early trends, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 26,188 points as of 7:45 am, suggesting that the Nifty 50 may open above Wednesday's closing level of 26,053.9.

Gold and silver prices recover from recent lows. Is it time to buy?After slipping to three-week lows earlier this week, gold and silver have regained some shine ahead of the US Fed's policy decision. As markets anticipate a possible rate cut, traders are now weighing whether this rebound marks a good buying opportunity.

Nvidia makes history, becomes first company to reach USD 5 trillion market valueThe milestone, reached just three months after Nvidia crossed USD 4 trillion, now surpasses the entire cryptocurrency market's value and equals nearly half of Europe's benchmark Stoxx 600 index.

Significant progress made in India-EU trade talks: Piyush Goyal after key meetsThe minister said that both sides are working towards a fair and reputable trade agreement, which will benefit businesses and consumers in India and the EU alike.

boAt's parent Imagine Marketing refiles for Rs 15-billion IPO after 2022 delayTwo years after postponing its IPO plans, boAt's parent company Imagine Marketing is back in the game, filing fresh documents for a Rs 15-billion public issue.

Can India's banks keep up with the economy's growth momentum?With growth and policy support aligned, India's economy is gaining momentum. The real question — can banks modernise fast enough to keep it going?

Sensex, Nifty end higher amid optimism over US Fed decisionThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 368.97 points to close at 84,997.13, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 117.70 points to settle at 26,053.90. Broader market indices also closed higher, with oil & gas and metal stocks leading the uptrend.

The story of the sons in Tata SonsTata Sons Private Limited, established in 1917, is the principal holding company and promoter of the Tata Group, India's largest and one of the world's most respected conglomerates.

Want to earn 3–4x more? These 4 countries are actively hiring IndiansSkilled Indians are catching the world's attention. An expert says that Germany, Japan, Finland and Taiwan — are actively hiring Indian professionals and offering salaries up to three to four times higher than those in India.

Why are NRIs flocking to buy homes in India?The transformation of India's real estate ecosystem has further strengthened this trust of the NRIs. Over the past decade, reforms such as the RERA improved project transparency, digitisation of land records and professionalisation of developers have collectively boosted buyer confidence.

8th Pay Commission: Cabinet clears terms of reference. What does this mean?With the Cabinet approving the Terms of Reference for the 8th Central Pay Commission, the countdown begins for the next pay and pension revision that could reshape earnings for millions of central government employees and pensioners.

India's organised farmstay market set to touch Rs 63,000 crore by 2029As city life grows more chaotic and polluted, many urban Indians are finding peace in the countryside. The growing shift towards wellness and greener living is now driving India's organised farmstay market to new heights.

The billion-dollar goodbye: Why global tech giants are spending more to let people goIn this deep-dive on global tech layoffs, we analyse severance costs, project realignments, and slowing demand cycles to understand why companies are standardising leaner headcounts and shifting toward automation-driven operational efficiency.

Gold, silver prices rise slightly ahead of US Fed decision. Check latest ratesOn the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), Gold December futures were trading at Rs 1,19,755 per 10 grams at 9:43 am, up modestly from Tuesday's close. Silver December futures were quoted at Rs 1,44,768 per kg, also showing a slight uptick after recent losses.

Sensex, Nifty open higher tracking Asian markets; US Fed decision in focusThe S&P BSE Sensex was trading 153.31 points higher at 84,781.47, while the NSE Nifty50 hovered just below the 26,000 level after briefly crossing it during early trade.

Gold and silver prices fall sharply. Should you buy now?With gold and silver prices falling sharply, investors are eyeing the market closely. Is now the right time to buy, or could prices dip further?

entertainment.headline: Baahubali The Epic US premieres: Epic, nostalgic and wild cinematic ride, say fans Director SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali: The Epic' had its early premiere in the US ahead of the global release. The director teased a 3D animation continuation, sparking excitement among fans.

Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat box office Day 9: Film collects Rs 51 crore in India 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat', starring Harshvardhan Rane and Sonam Bajwa, has crossed Rs 51 crore at the Indian box office in nine days. Despite competition from 'Thamma', the romantic drama continues its steady theatrical run across major cities.

Priyanka, Nick and Malti enjoy magical family time at Disney World Actor Priyanka Chopra shared adorable family photos from her Disney World trip with husband Nick Jonas, daughter Malti, and the Jonas family.

Deepika Padukone not credited in Kalki? Fans say name added after backlash Deepika Padukone's name was missing from 'Kalki 2898 AD' end credits, sparking fan outrage. Fans claimed that the production house added her name after backlash, raising questions over credit omission.

Hello Kitty movie finally gets a release date, hits theatres in July 2028 After years of anticipation, 'Hello Kitty' will make her Hollywood debut in 2028, in a Warner Bros film. Directed by Leo Matsuda, the movie promises a fun-filled adventure for all ages featuring Kitty White and other beloved Sanrio characters.

Thamma box office day 9: Ayushmann-Rashmika's horror comedy sees slight dip Ayushmann Khurrana and Rashmika Mandanna's 'Thamma' has crossed Rs 100 crore in just nine days, becoming the second-highest earner in the Maddock Horror Comedy Universe. Despite a slight weekday dip, the film continues its strong theatrical run across India.

Bigg Boss 19: Ashnoor Kaur's body-shaming on show proves we still haven't evolved 'Bigg Boss 19' contestants Tanya Mittal, Kunickaa Sadanand, and Neelam Giri have been facing backlash for body-shaming Ashnoor Kaur. Here's why the incident is a reminder that we, as a society, still haven't evolved.

Enrique Iglesias turns Mumbai into a dance floor on day 1 of concert  Enrique Iglesias returned to Mumbai after 13 years with a sold-out concert at MMRDA Grounds. The performance united multiple generations and reignited the city's love for his music.

KJo, Malaika compare contestant to Shashi Tharoor, his epic comeback is gold Congress MP Shashi Tharoor's trademark wit was on full display after Karan Johar and Malaika Arora compared a 'Pitch To Get Rich' contestant to him. His playful response on social media went viral, with fans urging the trio to meet and clear the fun confusion.

Camila Mendes engagement bash turns into a mini Riverdale reunion. Pics The cast of 'Riverdale' reunited at Camila Mendes' surprise engagement party, evoking nostalgic memories of 2017. Camila Mendes, who played Veronica Lodge, got engaged to her longtime boyfriend Rudy Mancuso.

Harshvardhan Rane: The outsider once called a fluke, now turns dismissal into power From being called a fluke to earning love twice at the box office this year, Harshvardhan Rane opens up about rejection, healing, and finding peace. He reflects on why he refuses to blame nepotism and how romanticising pain became his greatest strength.

BTS Jungkook sets pulses racing in new photoshoot: Feels good to be back BTS' Jungkook makes a striking comeback as the face of Calvin Klein's 2025 campaign. The luxury shoot, where the BTS star raises the temperature, has sent fans into a frenzy ahead of BTS' 2026 reunion.

Justin Bieber's take on cheating divides fans: Even a thought of lust is adultery Justin Bieber has sparked a fresh debate on fidelity by stating that even lustful thoughts amount to cheating. He said this amounts to adultery.

Adam Driver to headline Netflix's high-stakes hostage drama Rabbit, Rabbit Netflix has greenlit a new thriller, 'Rabbit, Rabbit', starring Adam Driver. Written by Peter Craig and directed by Philip Barantini, the hostage drama, likened to 'Dog Day Afternoon', promises a tense psychological showdown.

BB19 Episode 67: Mridul's captaincy tested, Farrhana refuses duties; house in chaos From captain Mridul's tears and walk-out threats to Farrhana's shocking accusations, the 'Bigg Boss 19' house drama peaked just before the new science task began.

Arshad Warsi admits regretting Jaani Dushman, did the film for money to build home Actor Arshad Warsi expressed regret over his role in the 2002 film 'Jaani Dushman'. Despite this, he highlighted director Rajkumar Kohli's generosity and professionalism, which helped him financially.

Diljit Dosanjh reacts to racist remarks in Sydney, calls for world beyond borders Actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh shared a video on YouTube that featured behind-the-scenes footage of his AURA tour in Australia. He also opened up on the racism he faced ahead of his Sydney concert.

Priyanka Chopra poses with pythons in throwback photos, hints a Mowgli connection Priyanka Chopra shared a series of pictures posing with pythons and a cobra. The post includes throwback images and features her husband Nick Jonas, sparking fan reactions.

De De Pyaar De 2: Watch Ajay, Rakul's new hook-step in Honey Singh's Jhoom Sharaabi Ajay Devgn and Rakul Preet Singh's party track 'Jhoom Sharaabi' was released. The song mixes classic Qawwali with modern beats and a unique hook-step.

general news.headline: Trump seals rare-earths deal in 'amazing' meet with Xi, to cut China tariffs 10%US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping held a landmark meeting in Busan, marking a promising new chapter in US-China relations. Key agreements on tariffs, soybean purchases, and rare earth exports signal a hopeful thaw in diplomatic ties.

Trump ends 33-year pause, orders immediate nuclear tests over Russia, China movesUS President Donald Trump has announced immediate nuclear weapons testing to match advancements by Russia and China. This move signals a renewed phase in America's nuclear weapons programme amid rising global tensions.

Major surge in pollution levels in Delhi as cloud seeding goes up in smokeDelhi AQI: Delhi's air quality hovered around the 'very poor' and 'severe' categories on Thursday as cloud seeding trials came a cropper. The capital's overall Air Quality Index (AQI) stood at 352.

Video: Bengaluru couple chases delivery agent for brushing against car, kills himInitially registered as an accident, the case turned into a murder probe when CCTV footage showed the car deliberately following and hitting the victims. The couple has been taken into custody.

Getting better: Shreyas Iyer's first message after spleen injury horrorIndia's ODI vice-captain Shreyas Iyer has shared a positive update on his recovery after suffering a rib injury during the third ODI against Australia in Sydney. The 29-year-old batter, who was admitted to intensive care following the incident, took to social media to thank fans for their messages and assured that he is making steady progress.

US drones, not India, real reason why Pak-Afghan peace talks crashedPakistan Defence Minister Khwaja Asif blamed India after the peace talks with Taliban-ruled Afghanistan failed. Though Islamabad might use that as the ruse, the real reason behind the crashing of the talks, which were initiated after a recent war got hundreds killed, is Pakistan's helplessness at preventing US drones from attacks inside Afghanistan.

Russian oil taps turned off. What it means for Indian refinersIndia's cheap Russian oil phase is fading as sanctions tighten. Refiners are shifting to costlier US and Middle Eastern grades, raising import costs and likely putting eventual pressure on fuel prices.

Grieving father shares bribery ordeal after daughter's death in now-deleted post Sivakumar K, former Chief Financial Officer of Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL), detailed his ordeal in a now-deleted LinkedIn post, sparking widespread outrage over corruption in the city.

Iran, Russia are building a railway line that could destroy western sanctionsAs Washington tightens its grip, Tehran and Moscow are laying tracks for a trade revolution that bypasses the West entirely. The question is no longer if sanctions will fail, but when.
Grokipedia is built by AI, but humans will have a chance to improve itElon Musk has launched Grokipedia, an AI-powered encyclopedia built by xAI and fuelled by the Grok language model.

Gold and silver prices recover from recent lows. Is it time to buy?After slipping to three-week lows earlier this week, gold and silver have regained some shine ahead of the US Fed's policy decision. As markets anticipate a possible rate cut, traders are now weighing whether this rebound marks a good buying opportunity.

Manager's fiery Reddit post targets WFH staff using 'power cut' excuse to skip callsIn a Reddit post, the manager explained how two members of a seven-person team often went offline during working hours, claiming power cuts or network outages.

Diljit Dosanjh reacts to racist remarks in Sydney, calls for world beyond bordersActor-singer Diljit Dosanjh shared a video on YouTube that featured behind-the-scenes footage of his AURA tour in Australia. He also opened up on the racism he faced ahead of his Sydney concert.

Distressed woman breaks AC coach window after purse theft as child watches onThe viral video shows the visibly distraught woman repeatedly striking and breaking the windowpane of her compartment, ignoring fellow passengers who requested her to stop.

Enrique Iglesias turns Mumbai into a dance floor on day 1 of concert Enrique Iglesias returned to Mumbai after 13 years with a sold-out concert at MMRDA Grounds. The performance united multiple generations and reignited the city's love for his music.

Why dismantling India's polio network could invite the virus backIndia plans to reduce its polio disease monitoring system. The move could risk allowing polio and other diseases to resurface amid ongoing regional virus threats.

Mountain to climb: Can India script an epic to stop the Australia juggernaut?Women's World Cup 2025, IND vs AUS Preview: Australia head into the semi-final as clear favourites, but Harmanpreet Kaur's India will back themselves to challenge the seven-time champions at the Dr DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

She entered as a 'special case.' She left as India's first woman engineerThe untold story of Ayyalasomayajula Lalitha, India's first woman engineer who entered college as a "special case" and rewired the future.

Watch: US forces sink narco-terror vessel in Pacific strike, 4 killedUS Defence Secretary Peter Hegseth said a US military strike destroyed a narco-trafficking vessel in the Eastern Pacific, killing four suspected smugglers. He warned, no safe haven for narco-terrorists.

Adulting is hard, but it's harder when your parents are fightingWatching your parents fight as an adult can feel deeply unsettling. You feel helpless, full of thoughts and emotions, yet unable to say or do much. And even if you don't show it, the emotional weight of those moments can be heavy.

Pak Army captain among 6 soldiers killed in clash with Taliban near Afghan borderA Pakistani Army captain and five soldiers were killed in a clash with Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) militants near the Afghan border in Kurram district.

Push them back to caves: Pakistan's Asif threatens Afghan Taliban after talks failPakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif threatened to obliterate the Afghan Taliban after failed peace talks, warning of a Tora Bora repeat if terror attacks in Pakistan continue from Afghan soil.

Normal to have friction now and then, but we must stay on right course: Xi to TrumpChinese President Xi Jinping and US President Donald Trump met in Busan, South Korea, signalling a hopeful tone towards stabilising economic ties and global peace efforts. Both leaders acknowledged differences but emphasised partnership for mutual development.

sports.headline: Sai Sudharsan shares Gautam Gambhir's advice that ended his run-drought: You will play Sai Sudharsan has opened up about Gautam Gambhir's reassuring message that helped him overcome a lean patch. The young India batter says the chat changed his mindset and restored his confidence at the crease.

The 29-year-old batter, who was admitted to intensive care following the incident, took to social media to thank fans for their messages and assured that he is making steady progress.

Arsenal face Crystal Palace, Cardiff take on Chelsea in League Cup quarter-finals Premier League leaders Arsenal will host Crystal Palace in the League Cup quarter-finals, while third-tier Cardiff City, the only non-Premier League team to make the last eight, will host Chelsea.

Cricket Australia posts USD 7 million loss despite bumper Ro-Ko comeback series Cricket Australia (CA) on Thursday revealed a net loss of A$11.3 million ($7.34 million) for the 2024–25 financial year, with rising operational costs outweighing the surge in revenue generated from hosting the high-profile Border-Gavaskar series against India.

Storm Alert: How India can clip Alyssa Healy's wings in the semis Women's World Cup, IND vs AUS: Alyssa Healy has been a force in ICC knockout matches, scoring centuries in both the 2022 semifinal and final. Can India find a way to stop her from going big again on Thursday in Navi Mumbai?

IND vs AUS, Women's World Cup semi-final weather: Will rain spoil Navi Mumbai clash? India's Women face defending champions Australia in a high-stakes World Cup semi-final at Navi Mumbai. But with rain threats looming, fans are left hoping the weather doesn't decide the outcome.

From 97-all-out to 319/7: How South Africa changed their fortune in semi-final South Africa went from 97-all-out against in their last group-stage game against Australia to hitting 319 runs in the semi-final against England. What changed? Marizanne Kapp reveals.

IND vs AUS, predicted XI: Toss up between Harleen, Radha in semi-final India are set to play Australia in the semi-final of the ODI World Cup. Will India make multiple changes in their line-up for knockout game?

Women's World Cup 2025, IND vs AUS Preview: Australia head into the semi-final as clear favourites, but Harmanpreet Kaur's India will back themselves to challenge the seven-time champions at the Dr DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

KL Rahul triggers IPL 2026 trade buzz with cheeky remark in new podcast KL Rahul's recent remarks have set off speculation over his IPL future as reports link him with a potential move from Delhi Capitals to Kolkata Knight Riders. The star batter's journey from IPL debutant to one of the league's most consistent performers adds intrigue to the ongoing trade discussions.

The star batter's journey from IPL debutant to one of the league's most consistent performers adds intrigue to the ongoing trade discussions.

Tears of joy: Marizanne Kapp buries ghosts of 2017 with 5-wicket spell in semisSouth Africa qualified for their first-ever ICC Women's World Cup final after defeating England by 125 runs. Marizanne Kapp's five-wicket haul and Laura Wolvaardt's 169 runs powered the historic victory.

Wolvaardt and Kapp fire South Africa into maiden final, send England homeWomen's World Cup: South Africa stormed into their maiden Women's World Cup final with a commanding 100-run win over England at the Barsapara Stadium in Guwahati on Wednesday. Laura Wolvaardt's sublime century and Marizanne Kapp's all-round brilliance powered the Proteas to a historic victory.

No favourites in the semi-final of World Cup: Australia head coachWomen's World Cup: Australia head coach believes that there are no favourites in the semi-final. Shelley Nitschke, speaking in the press conference said that Australia were wary of India's batting depth.

Australia to take late call on Alyssa Healy in semi-finals: Coach NitschkeWomen's World Cup: Australia are wary of India's batting depth, said head coach Shelley Nitschke ahead of the team's semi-final against the hosts. The coach also said that Australia would take a late call on playing Alyssa Healy.

God-sent Shafali Verma unfazed by Aussie firepower before semifinal testWomen's World Cup semi-final: Shafali Verma returns to the big stage after an unexpected call-up to India's World Cup squad. At just 21, with the experience of having faced the mighty Australians on numerous occasions, the opener is now eyeing a decisive impact in the high-stakes clash in Navi Mumbai on Thursday, 30 October.

Australia will come hard at us, but I'll back my strengths: Shafali VermaWomen's World Cup 2025, IND vs AUS: In the pre-match press conference, Shafali Verma said that she'll play her natural game, knowing that Australia will come hard at India when these two teams meet on Thursday at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

Vinicius apologises for Clasico outburst: Sometimes passion gets better of meReal Madrid striker Vinicius Jr. apologised for his outburst during the El Clasico. The footballer had lashed out after being substituted during the high-intensity encounter.

Laura Wolvaardt hits 169, first captain to score century in World Cup knockoutsEngland vs South Africa, Women's World Cup semifinal: South Africa captain Laura Wolvaardt smashed 169 off 143 deliveries, becoming the first captain to hit a hundred in a knockout game in the premier 50-over tournament's history. South Africa posted 319 in 50 overs in the semifinal in Guwahati.

South Africa posted 319 in 50 overs in the semifinal in Guwahati.

Suryakumar Yadav joins Rohit Sharma in elite list with explosive show in CanberraIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav reached 150 sixes in T20Is during the first match against Australia. He completed the milestone in 86 innings, becoming the fifth batter overall to reach the milestone.

41-year-old Sunil Chhetri signs new deal with Bengaluru FCLegendary Sunil Chhetri seems to have signed a new deal with Bengaluru FC. The club teased a video of his contract extension with a heartwarming video.

Suryakumar Yadav finds form before rain ends series opener in CanberraIndia vs Australia, 1st T20I: The opening T20I between India and Australia was abandoned due to persistent rain in Canberra. The washout denied fans a result but showcased Suryakumar Yadav's promising return and Abhishek Sharma's aggressive batting.

Miscommunication with Afghanistan board cleared: Coach Trott makes U-turnAfghanistan head coach Jonathan Trott has confirmed that any previous miscommunication with the Afghanistan Cricket Board (ACB) has been resolved, with both parties now on the same page ahead of the T20I series against Zimbabwe.

17-year-old Anahat Singh stuns defending champion to reach Canadian Open semis17-year-old Indian squash prodigy Anahat Singh stormed into the semi-final of the Canadian Open by beating defending champion Tinnie Gilis. This is the first time that Anahat beat a top-10-ranked player.

Shashi Tharoor slams selectors for ignoring Sarfaraz despite rich formCongress MP Shashi Tharoor criticises Indian selectors for excluding Sarfaraz Khan from the Test team despite his impressive domestic and international records. He stressed the need to value consistent domestic cricket performances over IPL form in team selection.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
